timeline.message: Move queries around, use named queries

timeline.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText: Think you can assume this is one or none due to "unique_workflowversion_names" UNIQUE CONSTRAINT, btree (parentid, name)
timeline.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText: throws exception when it's none and using singleResult, avoiding exception by using list. it's what i had originally 7145601  i prefered this to catching the exception
replies.author: garyluu

replies.bodyText:
Double-check classpath maybe, I have
	default R getSingleResult() {
		return uniqueResult();
	}

which goes to
	/**
	 * Convenience method to return a single instance that matches
	 * the query, or {@code null} if the query returns no results.
	 *
	 * @return the single result or <tt>null</tt>
	 *
	 * @throws NonUniqueResultException if there is more than one matching result
	 */

in hibernate-core:5.2.8-Final
replies.author: denis-yuen

replies.bodyText:
i still don't see that, the only place I see that comment is from the deprecated https://github.com/hibernate/hibernate-orm/blob/5.2.8/hibernate-core/src/main/java/org/hibernate/Query.java
though uniqueResult will work
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText: Does it make a difference if you do select count(v.id)..., or is JPA already smart enough not to load all the  version objects?
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText:
the resulting sql is identical:
org.hibernate.SQL: /* io.dockstore.webservice.core.Version.getCountByEntryId */ select count(version0_.id) as col_0_0_ from ( select id, commitID, dbCreateDate, dbUpdateDate, dirtyBit, frozen, name, reference, referenceType, valid, parentid, versionEditor_id, automated, cwlPath, dockerfilePath, imageId, lastBuilt, size, wdlPath, null::varchar as dagJson, null::boolean as isLegacyVersion, null::timestamp as lastModified, null::int4 as subClass, null::varchar as toolTableJson, null::varchar as workflowPath, 1 as clazz_ from tag union all select id, commitID, dbCreateDate, dbUpdateDate, dirtyBit, frozen, name, reference, referenceType, valid, parentid, versionEditor_id, null::boolean as automated, null::varchar as cwlPath, null::varchar as dockerfilePath, null::varchar as imageId, null::timestamp as lastBuilt, null::int8 as size, null::varchar as wdlPath, dagJson, isLegacyVersion, lastModified, subClass, toolTableJson, workflowPath, 2 as clazz_ from workflowversion ) version0_ where version0_.parentid=?
replies.author: garyluu

replies.bodyText:
That's lame.  Is that all of the SQL for this, or are they also fetching all the sourcefiles subsequently, since those aren't lazy loaded in this branch?
You'd probably need something like select count(*) from (select v.id from Version v where... and I'm not even sure you can do a nested query like that in JPQL.
Just commenting, I did approve.
replies.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: i have a feeling that would make it worse
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText: So if you detach, it executes for the versions that are present and doesn't fetch any more? Sounds like it, just wanted to confirm.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: From what I can tell, it's lazy loaded all the way to the end of the resource endpoint function.  when it's about to serialize, it checks that it needs to get the versions (in order to figure out the output/input file formats), and then it loads it. so yes, in the case i detach, it doesn't try to load it during the usual time
replies.author: garyluu

timeline.bodyText: do these need to be Long? these cannot be null
timeline.author: denis-yuen
denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText:
ditto for parameter
for the return type, might want to consider Optional<Long> to make the caller handle the case when the result is null (the entry doesn't exist) which is distinct from 0 (entry exists, but legitimately has no versions)
timeline.author: denis-yuen
